org.flixel.FlxObject

Packages that use FlxObject

Uses of FlxObject in org.flixel
 

Subclasses of FlxObject in org.flixel
 class FlxButton
          A simple button class that calls a function when clicked by the mouse.
 class FlxEmitter
          FlxEmitter is a lightweight particle emitter.
 class FlxGroup
          This is an organizational class that can update and render a bunch of FlxObjects.
 class FlxSound
          This is the universal flixel sound object, used for streaming, music, and sound effects.
 class FlxSprite
          The main "game object" class, handles basic physics and animation.
 class FlxText
          Extends FlxSprite to support rendering text.
 class FlxTileblock
          This is the basic "environment object" class, used to create simple walls and floors.
 class FlxTilemap
          This is a traditional tilemap display and collision class.

          Tells the camera to follow this FlxCore object around.

          Array of all the FlxObjects that exist in this layer.

 void FlxObject.hitBottom(FlxObject Contact, float Velocity)
          Called when this object's bottom edge collides with the top of another FlxObject.
 void FlxObject.hitLeft(FlxObject Contact, float Velocity)
          Called when this object's left side collides with another FlxObject's right.
 void FlxObject.hitRight(FlxObject Contact, float Velocity)
          Called when this object's right side collides with another FlxObject's left.
 void FlxObject.hitSide(FlxObject Contact, float Velocity)
          Since most games have identical behavior for running into walls, you can just override this function instead of overriding both hitLeft and hitRight.
 void FlxObject.hitTop(FlxObject Contact, float Velocity)
          Called when this object's top collides with the bottom of another FlxObject.

 boolean FlxTilemap.overlaps(FlxObject Core)

 void FlxObject.preCollide(FlxObject object)
          FlxU.collide() (and thus FlxObject.collide()) call this function each time two objects are compared to see if they collide.
